issues.title: User Authentication with OAuth2
issues.body:
## Description
As a user, I want to authenticate using OAuth2 providers so that I can securely access the application without creating a separate account.

## Business Value
Reduces user friction during onboarding and improves security by leveraging trusted identity providers.

## Acceptance Criteria
- User can select OAuth2 provider (Google, Microsoft, GitHub)
- Successful authentication redirects to application dashboard
- Failed authentication shows appropriate error message
- User profile is created/updated from OAuth2 data

issues.title: Export Data to CSV Format
issues.body:
## Description
As a data analyst, I want to export report data to CSV format so that I can perform further analysis in Excel or other tools.

## Preconditions
- User has at least one report generated
- User has permission to export data

## Acceptance Criteria
- Export button is visible on report page
- CSV file includes all report columns
- CSV file respects user's date/time format preferences
- Export completes within 30 seconds for reports up to 10,000 rows

## User Guide
1. Navigate to the report page
2. Click the "Export to CSV" button in the top-right corner
3. Wait for download to complete
4. Open the CSV file in your preferred tool

issues.title: Real-time Notification System
issues.body:
## Overview
Implement a real-time notification system that alerts users about important events without requiring page refresh.

## Business Value
Improves user engagement and ensures timely awareness of critical updates.

## Done Criteria
| Criteria | Status |
|----------|--------|
| WebSocket connection established | ✓ |
| Notifications appear as toast messages | ✓ |
| Users can dismiss notifications | ✓ |
| Notification history is accessible | ✓ |

## Connections
- Related to #5 (Push Notification Support)
- Depends on #12 (WebSocket Infrastructure)

issues.title: Multi-language Support for UI
issues.body:
## Summary
Add internationalization support to allow users to switch between English, French, and German languages.

## Prerequisites
- Translation keys are defined in locale files
- Language selector is added to user preferences

## AC
- User can select preferred language from profile settings
- UI text updates immediately after language change
- Selected language persists across sessions
- All user-facing text is translatable (no hardcoded strings)

## Last Edited
Updated by alice.smith@example.com on 2026-01-23

issues.title: Advanced Search with Filters
issues.body:
## Description
As a power user, I want to use advanced search filters to quickly find specific records based on multiple criteria.

## Why
Reduces time spent manually browsing through large datasets and improves productivity.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Search supports text, date range, and category filters
- Filters can be combined with AND/OR logic
- Search results update in real-time as filters are applied
- Search history is saved for quick access
- Export search results to CSV

issues.title: Dashboard Customization
issues.body:
## Description
Allow users to customize their dashboard by adding, removing, and rearranging widgets.

## Business Value
Enhances user experience by providing personalized views tailored to individual workflows.

## Preconditions
- User is logged in
- At least 3 widget types are available

## Acceptance Criteria
- Users can drag and drop widgets to reorder them
- Users can add widgets from a widget library
- Users can remove widgets they don't need
- Dashboard layout is saved automatically
- Layout persists across devices

## Instructions
### Adding a Widget
1. Click "Add Widget" button
2. Select widget type from dropdown
3. Configure widget settings
4. Click "Save"

### Removing a Widget
1. Hover over widget
2. Click the X icon in the top-right corner
3. Confirm deletion

issues.title: Audit Log for Compliance
issues.body:
## Description
Implement comprehensive audit logging to track all user actions for compliance and security purposes.

## Business Value
Ensures regulatory compliance (GDPR, SOX) and provides security incident investigation capabilities.

## Acceptance Criteria
- All CRUD operations are logged with timestamp, user ID, and action details
- Logs are immutable and stored in a tamper-proof format
- Logs are retained for 7 years
- Administrators can search and filter audit logs
- Failed login attempts are logged

## Related
- Links to compliance documentation: https://example.com/compliance
- See also: #15 (Role-Based Access Control)

issues.title: Email Notification Templates
issues.body:
## Overview
Create customizable email templates for various notification types (welcome, password reset, report ready, etc.).

## Value
Provides consistent branding and messaging across all email communications.

## Setup
- Email service (SendGrid/Mailgun) is configured
- Template variables are documented

## Done Criteria
- At least 5 email templates are available
- Templates support variable substitution (user name, links, etc.)
- Templates are responsive (mobile-friendly)
- Administrators can preview templates before sending
- Template changes are version-controlled

issues.title: Two-Factor Authentication (2FA)
issues.body:
## Description
As a security-conscious user, I want to enable two-factor authentication to add an extra layer of protection to my account.

## Business Value
Significantly reduces the risk of unauthorized account access and data breaches.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Users can enable 2FA via authenticator apps (Google Authenticator, Authy)
- Backup codes are generated and displayed once
- 2FA can be disabled with password confirmation
- Failed 2FA attempts are rate-limited
- SMS-based 2FA is supported as fallback

## User Guide
### Enabling 2FA
1. Go to Account Settings > Security
2. Click "Enable Two-Factor Authentication"
3. Scan QR code with authenticator app
4. Enter verification code to confirm
5. Save backup codes in a secure location

### Disabling 2FA
1. Go to Account Settings > Security
2. Click "Disable Two-Factor Authentication"
3. Enter current password
4. Enter 2FA code
5. Click "Confirm"

## History
Initially proposed in Q4 2025, prioritized for Q1 2026 release.

issues.title: API Rate Limiting
issues.body:
## Description
Implement rate limiting for all API endpoints to prevent abuse and ensure fair resource allocation.

## Business Value
Protects system availability and prevents denial-of-service attacks.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Rate limit is 100 requests per minute per API key
- Exceeding rate limit returns 429 status code with Retry-After header
- Rate limit counters reset every minute
- Premium users have higher rate limits (500 requests/minute)
- Rate limit status is visible in API response headers

## Connections
- Related to API documentation: https://api.example.com/docs
- See also: #18 (API Key Management)

issues.title: Scheduled Report Generation
issues.body:
## Description
Allow users to schedule automatic report generation and delivery via email at specified intervals.

## Business Value
Saves time by automating repetitive reporting tasks and ensures stakeholders receive timely updates.

## Preconditions
- User has created at least one report template
- Email service is configured and operational

## AC
- Users can schedule reports (daily, weekly, monthly)
- Reports are generated at the specified time
- Generated reports are emailed as PDF attachments
- Users can pause or cancel scheduled reports
- Failed report generations trigger alerts

## How To
1. Open the report you want to schedule
2. Click "Schedule" button
3. Select frequency (daily/weekly/monthly)
4. Choose delivery time
5. Enter recipient email addresses
6. Click "Save Schedule"

## Changes
Scheduling logic was refactored in v2.3 to improve reliability.

issues.title: Dark Mode Theme
issues.body:
## Summary
Implement a dark mode theme option to reduce eye strain and improve accessibility for users in low-light environments.

## Value
Enhances user comfort and accessibility, especially for users who work extended hours.

## Acceptance Criteria
- Theme toggle is available in user preferences
- Dark mode applies to all UI components
- Theme preference persists across sessions
- System theme preference is detected and applied automatically
- Contrast ratios meet WCAG AA standards

## Links
- Design mockups: https://figma.com/darkmode
- WCAG guidelines: https://www.w3.org/WAI/WCAG21/quickref/
